q:
In RESTful web services, you are working on REST-based architecture. Which of the following statements about the HTTP methods that are used in this architecture are correct:

  1. The GET method is used to provide write-only access to a resource.
  2. The POST method is used to create a new resource.
  3. The DELETE method is used to remove a resource
  4. The PUT method is used to update an existing resource or create a new resource.

You have an android project with two modules. In one module, you have a code with login functionality. You want to reuse the same code in another module. But, with extending the module option you got an error. So, you need to do it in another way by turning the module into a library. Which of the following option indicates the correct way to do the above task?

Options

1.

Find and module-level "build.gradle" file. 
At the top of file, add libraries{ id 'com.android.module' }. 
Remove the dependencies code in the same file. 
Save the file and click on File, choose Sync Project with Grade Files option.

2.

Find and module-level "build.gradle" file. 
In the file, remove the "applicationId" line and at the top of file,add plugins{ id'com.android.library' }. 
Save the file and click on File, choose Sync Project with Grade Files option.

3.

Right click on the module where you want to reuse code and select "Add library". 
Then choose "Open build.gradle" file and add plugins{ id 'com.android.library } code in the file. Click on save and run "Rebuild" command in build prompt.

4.

Find and module-level "build.gradle" file. 
At the top of file, add libraries{ id 'com.android.module' }. 
Save the file. Right click on module and choose Add Library option by enabling "Advanced options" in the window. 
Click on finish.

There is an android application in which you are using a module called "MyModule". You tried importing it to your project but the module did not find an error in the build window. You need to add the particular module to your project in Android Studio.
Which of the following option indicates the correct way to do the above task?

Options

1.

Click on File>New>New Library.
Select Android Library and click on Next.
Give "MyModule" as library name and search for the icon to select as app icon, then click Finish.

2.

Right click the project and select New Module option. 
It will redirect you to build command prompt. 
Given "Use MyModule" command and then click on Finish to start execution.

3.

Click on File>New>New Module. 
This will redirect you to build.gradle file. 
Under dependeny-build section, enter "MyModule". 
Click on save and Go to Android library window. Click on Finish.

4.

Click on File>New>New Module. 
Then Create New Module window opens. 
Select Android Library and click on Next. 
Give "MyModule" as library name and select a minimum SDK version for code in library, then click Finish.

You need to use a class in your app to interact and know about various services and activities. But the code given is incorrect to do the given process. Which of the following option indicates the correct code to do the given task?

Options

1.

use setContent(R.xml.activity_main) in the MainActivity

2.

use setContentView("activity_main.xml") in the MainActivity

3.

use setContentView(R.layout.activity_main) in the MainActivity

4.

use setContentLayout(R.layout.activity_main) in the MainActivity

In your android application, you have created a structure using XML code with file name "activity_main.xml". You need to set the content of MainActivity to be the layout residing in the given XML file. Which of the following option should be done to get the desired output?

Options

  1. public class NotificationManager extends Object{}
  2. public class ActivityManager extends Object{}
  3. public class ServiceManager extends Object{}
  4. public class ActivityManager extends Notification{}

You have used the given code in your android application for creating an object. This should specify the input to be collected from the user which will be passed along with intent that will be sent inside PendingIntent. But the code is not enabling the required functionality.

public class InputIntent extends Object implements ActivityManager{}

Which of the following option indicates the correct class to do the above task?

Options

  1. public class RemoteInput extends Activity implements Parcelable{}
  2. public class InputIntent extends Object implements Parcelable{}
  3. public class RemoteInput extends Object implements Parcelable{}
  4. public class InputIntent extends Activity implements ActivityManager{}

Your organization is using Cassandra to handle big data workloads. The Cassandra read process ensures fast reads. The Cassandra read process is illustrated in the diagram below:

The diagram explains the Cassandra read process in a cluster with two data centers, five racks, and 16 nodes. In the image, data row1 is placed in this cluster. Data row1 is a row of data with four replicas.

  • The first copy is stored on node 7 of data center 1
  • The second copy is stored on node 6 of data center 1
  • The third copy is stored on node 4 of data center 1
  • The fourth copy is stored on node 13 of data center 2

If a client process is running on data node 7 wants to access data row1, then what will be the order of read process preference of nodes in the above scenario?

Note: The order must be in highest to lowest priority

Cassandra is based on distributed system architecture. Any distributed system can strongly deliver any two out of the three properties: Consistency, Availability and Partition-tolerance. Cassandra provides flexibility for choosing between consistency and availability while querying data. Which of the following considerations related to data availability and consistency are correct?

Options

  1. The replication factor should ideally be an even number.
  2. The time required to get the acknowledgment from replicas is directly proportional to the number of replicas requests for acknowledgment. 
  3. The number of racks in a data center should be a factor of the replication factor.
  4. The common replication factor used is three, which provides a balance between replication overhead, data distribution, and consistency for most workloads.

Your organization is using Cassandra to handle big data workloads. Cassandra supports a per-operation tradeoff between consistency and availability through Consistency Levels. If replication factor RF = 3,  then from how many replicas a QUORUM request will require responses from?

Your organization is using Cassandra to handle big data workloads. Cassandra uses a Last-Write-Wins Element-Set conflict-free replicated data type for each CQL row to resolve conflicting mutations on replica sets. Which of the following data type will you use to resolve conflicting mutations on replica sets for each CQL row?

Your organization is using Cassandra to handle big data workloads. You have Docker Desktop for Windows software installed in your system. Which of the following commands can you use to start Cassandra using Docker?

Commands

1.

docker run --name cassandra cassandra

2.

docker run --name cassandra

3.

docker pull cassandra:latest

4.

docker push cassandra:latest

5.

docker run --rm -d --name cassandra --hostname cassandra --network cassandra

6.

docker run --rm -d --name cassandra --hostname cassandra --network cassandra cassandra

You are working in an organization and to meet emerging requirements for highly available storage systems, you started using Apache Cassandra. In Cassandra, commitlog segments are limited by the commitlog_segment_size_in_mb. Max mutation size is also configurable via max_mutation_size_in_kb setting in cassandra.yaml. What is the default size of max_mutation_size_in_kb?

You are working in an organization and to meet emerging requirements for highly available storage systems, you started using Apache Cassandra. To provide durability in the case of an unexpected shutdown, any data written to Cassandra will first be written to a commit log. Commitlog Segments are limited by the commitlog_segment_size_in_m. What is the default size of commitlog_segment_size_in_mb?

You are working in an organization and to meet emerging requirements for scalable, reliable, and highly available storage systems, you started using Apache Cassandra. 

Apache Cassandra configuration settings can be configured in which of the following files?

Apache Cassandra was initially designed using a staged event-driven architecture (SEDA) to implement a combination of Amazon’s Dynamo distributed storage and replication techniques. 

Each node in the Dynamo system has which of the following components?

  1. Request coordination over a partitioned dataset component
  2. Foreign keys or referential integrity component
  3. Ring membership and failure detection component
  4. A local persistence (storage) engine component

You are working in an organization and to meet emerging requirements for scalable, reliable, and highly available storage systems, you started using Apache Cassandra. Which of the following challenges and design objectives are handled by Cassandra systems?

  1. Partitioned key-oriented queries
  2. Distributed joins
  3. Flexible schema
  4. Cross partition transactions
  5. Full multi-master database replication

Interfacing DMA controller 8257 with 8086,
so that the channel 0 DMA address register has an IO address 80H
and the mode set register has an address 88H .
    Initialize the 8257 with Enable TC stop,Enable Channel 0 , Disable auto-load,
disable extended-write, disable rotating priority,disable all other channels.
For move 2kB of data from peripheral device to memory. what is the value of the address.?

In the DMA controller ,
The address register A15, A14 = 1 ,0 respectively,
Then what type of the DMA operation?

In a intel 8257 DMA controller,
    If the address register A3 A2 A1 A0 = 0 1 0 0 respectively,
And Clear First/last flip flop is = 0 ,
Then Which channel is selected ?

A 4-stage pipeline has stage delays of 150,200,160,140 nanosec respectively.
Inter stage buffer delay is 10 microsec.
Registers used constant clock rate.
The total time taken to process 1000 data items on this pipeline.

In a intel DMA controller ,
The IO read and hold acknowledge pin is ?

a.option: Active low and active High respectively
Active low and active low respectively
Active High and active High respectively
Active High and active low respectively

q:
In 8237 DMA controller ,
How many don't care bits are availiable in Request Register(RR),
    and what are the bits (D0,D1) to select channel '2' respectively.?
In the DMA Controller status register , What is the 5th bit ?

Consider that a level of the memory hierarchy has a hit rate of 20 % . Memory requests take 5 ns to complete if they hit in the level, and memory requests that miss in the level take 10 nsec to complete , the average access time of the level is ?

The semiconductor RAM of the Digital Computer has word length of 32-bits and capacity of 4294967296 words. it has a cycle time of 20 nsec. Then the time required to fill 2048 bytes of this memory with all 0's will be ?

In a magnetic drive of 1024 tracks,
1024 sectors per track,
2048 bytes per sector and it is rotating with 3000 rpm,
a). what is the capacity of disk.?
b). what is the data transfer rate of disk.?

 

Options

  1. a). 2GB  
b). 100MBps

     

  2. a). 4GB 
b). 400MBps

     

  3. a). 1GB 
b). 1000MBps

     

  4. a). 4GB 
b). 200MBps

In Android, you are working on Data Binding Library, to build a widget. It's a widget that changes dynamically, displaying weather. Based on your knowledge and situation working on Data Binding Library which of the following statements would you conclude as correct?

 

Statements:

  1.  The Data Binding Library allows you to bind UI components in your layouts to data sources in your app.
     
  2. The following code assigns text to the widget directly in the layout file- 
    <TextView android:text="@{viewmodel.userName}" />

     

  3. The Data Binding Library binds UI components at runtime.

You are working on a student portal application using  Android and you have a student database. Now if you are using SQLite as the database management system then which of the following Android architectures can you use to work with the student database in your app?

 

Architecture:

  1. ViewModel
     
  2. Room
     
  3. Data Binding
     
  4. Paging

Alice is working on the Greenplum architecture. She has implemented PostgreSQL Multiversion Concurrency Control (MVCC) model to manage concurrent transactions for heap tables. Now, which of the following statements about snapshots are correct:

Statements

  1. A snapshot is the set of rows that are visible at the beginning of a statement or transaction. 
  2. The snapshot ensures the query has a consistent and valid view of the database for the duration of its execution.
  3. When a transaction inserts a row, the transaction ID (XID) is saved with the row in the xmax system column.
  4. When a transaction deletes a row, the transaction ID (XID) is saved in the xmin system column.

Mary is working on the  SwiftUI architecture for her iOS project. She has observed that view components access the state of Store objects and send Action objects to trigger certain actions. Now, which of the following types of architectures must have been implemented in her project in this scenario?

Lisa built a small SwiftUI application. But after a long time, she realised that her application was hard to maintain and test. She realised that it was due to the architecture she preferred to built the application. Considering the above scenario which of the following SwiftUI app architectures does Lisa used.

 

Architectures

  1. Model-View
  2. Redux
  3. ViewState MVVM

Consider you are working on SwiftUI app architectures. If you are required to use the architecture such that it should be easy to swap out business logic for individual views and also for the whole app. Then which of the following architectures would you prefer?

 

App Architectures

  1. Model-View
  2. Redux
  3. ViewState MVVM

In Snowflake, you are setting the scaling policy for a multi-cluster warehouse. You are using the ‘Economy’ Scaling policy to conserve credits so that you don't need to start additional clusters, instead the running clusters could be fully loaded, which could lead to some of the queries taking comparatively longer completion time. When would the clusters start in such case?

a.option: If the system estimates there’s enough query load to keep the cluster busy for at least 6 minutes
If the system estimates that the query time limit has crossed
When a query is queued or the system detects that there’s one more query
When a query is queued for more than 10 seconds or the system detects that there’s one more query

q: In Snowflake, you are working on its architecture. Which of the following is used to handle the queries where each node in the cluster stores a portion of the entire data set locally?

In Selenium, which of these statements about the following command are correct:

Command

driver.quit();

Statements

  1. It is used to close all the windows and tabs associated with that WebDriver session
  2. It is used to close the browser process.
  3. If you are using the Selenium Grid, then this command is used to inform the Selenium Grid that the browser is no longer in use so it can be used by another session.

In Selenium, if you are working on the components of the WebDriver architecture, then which of the following statements about the JSON WIre Protocol are correct:

  1. It provides a transport mechanism to transfer data between a server and a client.
  2. It is used to establish a secure connection with the browser without revealing the internal logic of the browser's functionality.
  3. It serves as an industry standard for various REST web services.

In Teradata, which of the following statements about the secondary index are correct:
1. It is used for the data distribution in all the Access Module Processors.
2. Its values are stored in sub-tables that are built in all the Access Module Processors.
3. It requires maintenance because the sub-tables are required to be updated for each row of a table.

In Teradata, you are working on the spaces. Which of the following statements about the permanent space are correct:
1. It is the minimum amount of space that is available for a user to hold the data rows.
2. The storage of this space is divided by the number of Access Module Processors.

In Teradata, you are working on the Massive Parallel Processing (MPP) architecture. Which of the following statements about the responsibilities of the Parsing Engine are correct:

  1. It receives an SQL query from a client.
  2. It receives the privileged access modifiers against the objects that are used in the SQL query.
  3. It receives responses from Access Module Processors and sends them to the client.

In Teradata, you are working on compressions. If you have executed the following SQL query, then which of these statements in this scenario are correct:

CREATE SET TABLE hack_emp_data(
     emp_id CHAR(10),
     first_name CHAR(30),
     last_name CHAR(30),
     date_of_joining DATE FORMAT 'YYYY-MM-DD-',
     salary int,
     dep_id CHAR(10) COMPRESS(1,2,3))
    
  1.     The compressed values on the column to which the COMPRESS statement is applied to are stored in a new row.
  2.     The compressed values on the column to which the COMPRESS statement is applied to are stored in the table header in every Access Module Processor.
  3.     The presence bits are added to the table rows to indicate these values.
In Teradata, which of the following commands is used to return Parsing Engines to the users instead of the Access Module Processors?

In Teradata, compression is used to reduce the storage that is used by the tables. Which of the following statements about the limitations of using this compression technique are correct:
1. Only 256 values can be compressed for one column.
2. The primary index cannot be compressed.
3. The tables that are implemented in the spool space cannot be compressed.
In Teradata, you are given a student_data table. If you are required to view the collected statistical data on this table, then which of the following SQL queries is used to perform this task?

In Teradata, which of the following methods is used to collect the statistical data from a table:
1. Using the Random Access Module Processor (AMP) sampling technique
2. Using the COLLECT SAMPLING option inside an Access Module Processor (AMP)
3. Using the full statistics collection technique
In Teradata, which of the following unused permanent spaces is used to store the data and definitions for global temporary tables?
In Teradata, you are working on the primary indexing technique. If you have a table that contains the Unique Primary Index (UPI), then which of the following statements in this scenario are correct?

a.option: The column to which this index is associated should not contain any primary key.
The column to which this index is associated should not contain any foreign key.
The column to which this index is associated should not contain any duplicate elements.
UPI cannot be associated with a specific column of a table.

q:
In Teradata, you are given an employee_data table with details such as the employee ID, employee’s salary, and the number of working months for an employee. Determine the output of the following SQL query: Table:employee_data

Table:employee_data

emp_id

salary

working_months

22

4500

9

21

5000

13

32

5000

2

25

2000

5

29

8000

12

20

1500

8

 

select emp_id from emp1 where salary<(select avg(salary) from emp1) order by emp_id desc;

  1. emp_id

    32

    25

    21

  2. emp_id

    32

    25

    22

    20

  3. emp_id

    25

    22

  4. emp_id

    25

    20

In Teradata, which of the following statements about the INTERVAL function are correct:
1. It is used to perform all the relational and logical operations on DATE and TIME values.
2. There are two types of INTERVAL functions, Year-Month and Date-Time.
3. There are three values in the Year-Month interval function.

In Teradata, you are given two tables, emp_data and emp_salary. You have combined these two tables by combining multiple SELECT statements. Which of the following commands returns the rows of the first SELECT statement that are not in the second SELECT statement:
1. UNION
2. MINUS
3. EXCEPT

In Teradata, you are implementing different data manipulation statements. If you are required to implement the SET operator for multiple SELECT statements in your SQL query, then which of the following rules about this operator are correct:

1. The number of columns from each SELECT statement should be greater than the number of rows from the entire table.
2. The data types from each SELECT statement must be compatible
3. ORDER BY should only be included in the final SELECT statement.

In Teradata, you are implementing different data definition statements on your database. You are given a table named Students that contains the details of the students from a section such as the student ID, name, and percentage. If you are required to print the names of the students whose IDs are in the range of 11 to 20, then which of the following SQL commands is used to perform this action:
    
Table name: student

student_id

first_name

Percentage

1

Alice

90

4

Bob

91

21

Tara

56

20

Anita

35

14

Ben

89

17

Mary

62

a.option: select first_name from students where student_id range(11,20);
select first_name from students where student_id from 11 to 20;
select first_name from students where student_id between 11 and 20;
select first_name from students where student_id between 11 to 20;

q: In Teradata, you are implementing different data manipulation statements in your database. If you are required to insert the data that is available in another table into your database, then which of the following statements is used to perform this action?
Which of the following types of tables is used to hold the intermediate data during the data transmission in Teradata?

In Teradata, you are working on its architecture. You have executed an SQL query to insert the records in the table of your database. If the Parsing engine sends the records to BYNET and BYNET sends the records to the target Access Module Processors (AMP), then which of the following architecture techniques is implemented in this scenario?

In Teradata, you are working on the Massive Parallel Processing (MPP) architecture. Which of the following statements about the Message Passing Layer are correct:

1. It allows communication between the Parsing Engine and Access Module Processors.
2. It receives the execution plan from the Parsing Engine and sends it to the Access Module Processors.
3. It receives the results from the Access Module Processors and sends it to the Parsing Engine.

In Teradata, you are working on the Massive Parallel Processing (MPP) architecture. Which of the following components contains its own operating system, CPU, memory, a copy of the Teradata RDBMS software, and disk space?
Which of the following in MS SSIS allows to manage and monitor a package?

In Selenium, you are working with WebDriver architecture. Which of the following components are available in this architecture:

  1. Selenium Language Bindings
  2. Selenium controller modules
  3. JSON Wire Protocol
  4. Browser Drivers
  5. Real Browsers

You are implementing the automation testing for your website. If you have observed that there are issues due to variations in the time lag for the web elements, then which of the following commands are used to analyze and troubleshoot these issues in this scenario?
Which of the following controller autopopulates a form bean from the request?

In Teradata, which of the following clauses are used to check a row against a condition inside the CASE expression:
1. IF
2. WHEN
3. THEN
4. ELSE

In Teradata, which of the following tables is used to store duplicate records:

  1. SET 
  2. MULTISET
What is the length of the BIGINT data type in Teradata?
In Teradata, which of the following SQL commands is used to collect statistical data from a table?

In Teradata, you are working on the joins. Which of the following statements about the RIGHT OUTER JOIN are correct:
1. It returns all the data from the rows that are in the right table.
2. It returns all the data from the rows that are in the left table.
3. It returns the data only from the matching rows that are in the right table.
4. It returns the data only from the matching rows that are in the left table.

In Teradata, which of the following statements about the COALESCE statement are correct:
1. It returns all the first non-null values of the expressions of a table.
2. It returns NULL if all the arguments in the expression are NULL.
3. It is used to evaluate the table strength with respect to conditional complexity when multiple rows are deleted from a table.

Which of the following are valid Spring's AOP configuration elements?

i. <aop:advisor>

ii. <aop:around>

iii. <aop:aspect>

iv. <aop:after-returning>

In Teradata, you are given two tables named student_details and b. You have combined these two tables by combining multiple SELECT statements. If you are required to return the rows of the first SELECT statement that matches with the corresponding rows of the second SELECT statement, then which of the following commands is used to perform this task?
Which among the following classes is considered as an entry point to an Spring Web MVC project?
Which of the following is a component in the MS SSIS package?
Which of the following parts of MS SSIS architecture saves the layout of packages?
How many types of configuration are present in MS SSIS 2008?
In MS SSIS, which of the following is used to create custom components or custom applications that are used to create, load, run, and manage a package?
Which of the following is not a component of MS SSIS architecture?

Bob is working on Informatica Architecture. If he is required to manage the domain operations such as logging, authentication, and authorization, then which of the following services provided by the Informatica Domain must be implemented to perform this action in this scenario?

You are working with Informatica Architecture. Which of the following statements about Informatica Domain are correct:

Statements

  1. The Informatica domain consists of nodes and services where these nodes and services are categorized into folders or sub-folders based on administration requirements and design architecture.
  2. The Console web page of the Informatica administrator creates a domain that looks like a folder. Inside this folder, we can create a node with the services.
  3. In the Informatica domain, all the services and processes run outside the domain in the Informatica.

Alice is working on the Informatica Architecture. If she is required to maintain Informatica metadata and provides access to the same metadata to other services, then which of the following services from the Informatica ETL tool must be implemented by her to perform this action in this scenario?
